SystemManager¶

class pymultimatic.systemmanager.SystemManager(user: str, password: str, session: aiohttp.client.ClientSession, smartphone_id: str = 'pymultiMATIC', serial: Optional[str] = None, application: Optional[str] = 'SYSTEMCONTROL_MULTIMATIC')¶

This is a convenient manager to help interact with vaillant API.

The manager is calling the ApiConnector, the manager will provide to correct payloads and urls according to what you want to do.

The manager is throwing ApiError without altering it.

Parameters

  • user (str) – User to login with.

  • password (str) – Password associated with the user.

  • session – (aiohttp.ClientSession): Session.

  • smartphone_id (str) – This is required by the API to login.

  • serial (str) – If you have multiple facilities, you can specify which one to access

  • application (str) – Multimatic or senso app (default multimatic)

async login(force_login: bool = False) → bool¶

Try to login to the API, see login()

Parameters

force_login (bool) – Whether the login should be forced or not.

Returns

True/False if authentication succeeded or not.

Return type

bool

async logout() → None¶

Get logged out from the API, see logout()

async remove_holiday_mode() → None¶

Remove HolidayMode.

Note

There is a little workaround here, since the API doesn’t simply accept a DELETE request to remove the HolidayMode, so the manager is setting:

  • the start date to two days before

  • the end date to yesterday

  • temperature to frost protection

  • active to False

This will ensure the HolidayMode is not active.

async remove_quick_mode() → None¶

Removes current QuickMode.

Note

if there is not QuickMode set, the API returns an error (HTTP 409). This error is swallowed by the manager, so you don’t have to handle it.

async remove_room_quick_veto(room_id: str) → None¶

Remove the QuickVeto from a Room.

Parameters

room_id (str) – Id of the room.

async remove_zone_quick_veto(zone_id: str) → None¶

Remove the QuickVeto from a Zone.

Parameters

zone_id (str) – Id of the zone.

async request_hvac_update() → None¶

Request an hvac update. This allow the vaillant API to read the data from your system.

This is necessary to update BoilerStatus and Error

Note

The request done by the manager is done synchronously, but the update processing (basically, reading data from your system) is done asynchronously by vaillant API.

Note

The manager will try to reduce number of call, I think the call is costly. If the SyncState is_pending, the manager will skip the call to the API.

it can take some times for the update to occur (Most of the time, it takes about 1 or 2 minutes before you can see changes, if any)

It the request is done too often, the API may return an error (HTTP 409).

async set_holiday_mode(start_date: datetime.date, end_date: datetime.date, temperature: float) → None¶

Set the HolidayMode.

Parameters

  • start_date (date) – Start date of the holiday mode.

  • end_date (date) – End date of the holiday mode.

  • temperature (float) – Target temperature while holiday mode is_applied

async set_hot_water_operating_mode(dhw_id: str, new_mode: pymultimatic.model.mode.OperatingMode) → None¶

Set new operating mode for HotWater. The mode should be listed here MODES otherwise it won’t have any effect.

Note

To set QuickMode, you have to use set_quick_mode().

Note

This call won’t have any effect if there is a QuickMode activated, if you want to remove the quick mode, use remove_quick_mode().

Parameters

  • dhw_id (str) – domestic hot water id.

  • new_mode (OperatingMode) – The new mode to set.

async set_hot_water_setpoint_temperature(dhw_id: str, temperature: float) → None¶

This set the target temperature for hot water.

async set_quick_mode(quick_mode: pymultimatic.model.quick_mode.QuickMode) → None¶

Set a QuickMode system wise.

This will override the current QuickMode, if any.

Parameters

quick_mode (QuickMode) – the quick mode to set, see QuickModes

async set_room_operating_mode(room_id: str, new_mode: pymultimatic.model.mode.OperatingMode) → None¶

Set new operating mode for Room. The mode should be listed here MODES otherwise it won’t have any effect.

Note

To set QuickMode, you have to use set_quick_mode().

Note

This call won’t have any effect if there is a QuickMode activated, if you want to remove the quick mode, use remove_quick_mode().

Note

To set QuickVeto, you have to use set_room_quick_veto()

Parameters

  • room_id (str) – id of the room.

  • new_mode (OperatingMode) – The new mode to set.

async set_room_quick_veto(room_id: str, quick_veto: pymultimatic.model.mode.QuickVeto) → None¶

Set a QuickVeto for a Room. It will override the current QuickVeto, if any.

Parameters

  • room_id (str) – Id of the room.

  • quick_veto (QuickVeto) – Quick veto to set.

async set_room_setpoint_temperature(room_id: str, temperature: float) → None¶

Set the new current target temperature for a Room.

Note

Setting the target temperature this way will actually set the room operating mode to MANUAL (and target temperature to the desired temperature). It means the target temperature will remain the same until you change the target temperature again or the operating mode.

Parameters

  • room_id (str) – Id of the room.

  • temperature (float) – Target temperature to set.

async set_ventilation_operating_mode(ventilation_id: str, mode: pymultimatic.model.mode.OperatingMode) → None¶
Set ventilation at night level.

Compatible modes are listed here MODES

Parameters

  • ventilation_id (str) – id of the ventilation

  • mode (OperatingMode) – Mode to set

async set_zone_cooling_operating_mode(zone_id: str, new_mode: pymultimatic.model.mode.OperatingMode) → None¶

Set new operating mode to cool a Zone. The mode should be listed here MODES otherwise it won’t have any effect.

Note

To set QuickMode, you have to use set_quick_mode().

Note

This call won’t have any effect if there is a QuickMode activated, if you want to remove the quick mode, use remove_quick_mode().

Note

To set QuickVeto, you have to use set_zone_quick_veto()

Parameters

  • zone_id (str) – id of the zone.

  • new_mode (OperatingMode) – The new mode to set.

async set_zone_cooling_setpoint_temperature(zone_id: str, temperature: float) → None¶

Set the configured cooling temperature for the ON mode.

Note

It won’t alter the OperatingMode.

Parameters

  • zone_id (str) – Id of the zone.

  • temperature (float) – New temperature.
